item.title: 韩国批准谷歌出口高精度地图数据的申请
item.description: 韩国周五表示，已批准谷歌将该国高精度地图数据出口至海外服务器的申请。这是二十年来首次批准该请求，标志着重大政策逆转，为这家美国科技巨头进入本土应用主导的市场扫清了障碍。【原文：South Korea said on Friday it had approved Google's request to export the country's high-precision map data to overseas servers, a major reversal after two decades of rejection that clears the way for the U.S. tech giant to enter a market dominated by local apps.】

item.title: AI boom will be no free pass for debt-laden major economies
item.description: 经济学家表示，人工智能生产力革命若能实现，或许能为主要经济体争取更多时间来整顿其紧张的公共财政，但它无法承担最艰巨的任务。【原文：An AI productivity boom, if it materialises, may help buy major economies more time to clean up their strained public finances, economists say, although it won't do the heavy lifting.】

item.title: NTT数据公司高管称，今年将在印度增聘5000名员工
item.description: 日本科技公司NTT Data计划今年在印度增加5000名员工，涉及软件编程、咨询和IT支持等领域，该公司一位高管向路透社透露。【原文：Japanese technology firm NTT Data plans to raise its India headcount by 5,000 employees this year across software programming, consulting and IT support, a senior executive told Reuters.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称任天堂计划通过京都银行等机构进行约19亿美元的股票发售
item.description: 据三位知情人士透露，任天堂计划逐步减持战略股权，包括三菱日联银行和京都银行在内的多家机构将出售这家"超级马里奥"制造商的股份。【原文：Nintendo plans an unwinding of strategic shareholdings that would see companies including MUFG Bank and the Bank of Kyoto selling shares of the "Super Mario" maker, according to three sources familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 现代汽车集团将在韩国投资63亿美元建设人工智能数据中心和机器人工厂
item.description: 韩国国土交通部周五表示，现代汽车集团与韩国政府签署协议，将在韩国西部沿海地区投资约9万亿韩元（62.6亿美元）建设人工智能数据中心、机器人制造工厂等项目。【原文：Hyundai Motor Group and South Korea on Friday signed a deal to invest about 9 trillion won ($6.26 billion) to build an AI data centre, a robot manufacturing factory and other developments in the country's western coastal region, the land ministry said.】

item.title: 澳大利亚Appen公司表示，作为人工智能领域的"瑞士"，其人工测试需求正持续增长。
item.description: 澳大利亚Appen公司是人工智能系统人工评估服务的主要供应商，该公司表示，日益高涨的技术保护主义将推动中美两国对其服务的采购需求——这些服务通过真人参与来训练和测试模型。【原文：Australia's Appen , a big supplier of human assessment of artificial intelligence systems, said rising technology protectionism would boost demand in the United States and China for its services that use real people to train and test models.】

item.title: 澳元跳涨，日元暴跌，利率博弈主导二月市场
item.description: 周五澳元有望再创单月大幅涨幅，因市场预期央行将采取更强硬的政策立场；与此同时，日元则面临贬值压力，日本央行正面临着一位愈发激进的通胀主义首相的挑战。【原文：The Australian dollar was poised for another sharp monthly gain on Friday as expectations grow for a more hawkish central bank, while the yen was headed for a loss as the Bank of Japan contends with an emboldened reflationist prime minister.】

item.title: 亚洲股市下跌，日元和美国国债上涨，因人工智能和伊朗问题引发担忧
item.description: 周五亚洲交易时段，市场情绪持续低迷，科技公司估值担忧拖累股价，中东紧张局势则令能源市场持续承压。【原文：Dour sentiment persisted in the Asian trading day on Friday as concerns about technology company valuations weighed on shares and Middle East tensions kept energy markets on edge.】

item.title: 油价小幅回落，因美国与伊朗延长谈判
item.description: 周五油价下跌，本周有望录得跌幅。此前美国与伊朗就该欧佩克成员国的核计划延长谈判，缓解了市场对潜在敌对行动可能扰乱供应的担忧。【原文：Oil prices fell on Friday and were on track for a weekly decline after the United States and Iran extended talks over the OPEC member's nuclear programme, easing concerns about potential hostilities that could disrupt supply.】

item.title: 巴拿马官员搜查和记黄埔子公司办公室，消息人士称
item.description: 一位熟悉行动的消息人士周四向路透社透露，巴拿马当局搜查了香港财团和记黄埔旗下一个部门的当地办公室。【原文：Panamanian authorities conducted a search of a local office belonging to a unit of Hong Kong conglomerate CK Hutchison office, a source familiar with operation told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: Zscaler季度亏损扩大，支出增加；股价下跌9%
item.description: Zscaler周四公布的第二季度净亏损扩大，公司表示在竞争激烈的市场中，销售、营销及研发支出增加是主要原因。受此消息影响，这家云安全公司的股价在盘后交易中下跌约9%。【原文：Zscaler on Thursday posted a wider net loss in the second quarter, citing higher spending on sales, marketing, and research and development in a competitive market, sending shares of the cloud security firm down roughly 9% in extended trading.】

item.title: 《华尔街日报》称美联储对司法部传票提出质疑
item.description: 《华尔街日报》周四报道称，美国联邦储备委员会正就美国检察官珍妮·皮罗对主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔的刑事调查中签发的两份传票，展开一场闭门法律挑战。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve is waging a behind-closed-doors legal challenge to two subpoenas issued in U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro's criminal investigation of Chair Jerome Powell, the Wall Street Journal said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国称美委石油协议销售额预计2月底前达20亿美元
item.description: 美国能源部长克里斯·赖特周四在得克萨斯州向记者表示，委内瑞拉与美国之间一项旗舰石油供应协议的销售额预计将在本月底达到20亿美元。【原文：Sales under a flagship oil supply agreement between Venezuela and the U.S. are expected to reach $2 billion by the end of this month, U.S. Secretary of Energy Chris Wright told reporters in Texas on Thursday.】

item.title: 英国活动人士计划就人工智能数据中心的气候和社会影响举行抗议活动
item.description: 活动人士将于周五走上英国街头，展开为期两天的抗议活动，反对为满足人工智能蓬勃发展需求而扩建数据中心，并抗议这些设施对社区和环境造成的影响。【原文：Activists are set to take to British streets on Friday for two days of protests against the expansion of data centres to serve booming demand for artificial intelligence, and the impact of the facilities on communities and the environment.】

item.title: 日本首都核心通胀放缓，跌破央行2%目标
item.description: 日本央行周五公布的数据显示，随着食品价格涨幅趋缓，日本2月份核心通胀率有所放缓。这为消费者带来些许喘息之机，但同时也增加了央行在解释进一步加息必要性时的沟通难度。【原文：Annual core inflation in Japan's capital slowed in February as food price hikes run their course, data showed on Friday, offering consumers some relief but complicating the central bank's communication in justifying further rate hikes.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称委内瑞拉暂停19份马杜罗政府时期签署的油气生产分成合同
item.description: 委内瑞拉石油部已暂停19份在总统尼古拉斯·马杜罗政府时期与私营企业签署的石油生产分成合同，四位知情人士向路透社透露了这一消息。【原文：Venezuela's oil ministry has suspended 19 oil production-sharing contracts with private companies signed under the administration of President Nicolas Maduro, four sources with knowledge of the move told Reuters.】

item.title: 白宫官员承诺对航空业展现"新关注"，此前航班问题频发
item.description: 白宫副幕僚长詹姆斯·布莱尔周四表示，在与妻子分别遭遇美国航空航班问题后，他将对美国航空业产生"新的关注"。【原文：Deputy White House Chief of Staff James Blair vowed on Thursday to take a "new interest" in the U.S. aviation industry after he and his wife experienced issues with separate American Airlines flights.】

item.title: 美国法官裁定：币安无权调解客户因加密货币损失提出的索赔
item.description: 周四，一名联邦法官驳回了币安的请求。此前，多家客户指控这家全球最大的加密货币交易所非法销售未注册代币，导致这些代币价值大幅缩水，并要求通过仲裁解决索赔事宜。【原文：A federal judge on Thursday rejected Binance's request that customers who accused the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange of illegally selling unregistered tokens that lost much of their value arbitrate their claims.】

item.title: 据《The Information》报道，Meta达成数十亿美元协议租用谷歌AI芯片
item.description: 据《The Information》周四报道，Meta Platforms已与谷歌达成一项价值数十亿美元的协议，将租赁谷歌的人工智能芯片以开发新型AI模型。该报道援引了参与谈判人士的消息。【原文：Meta Platforms has signed a multi-billion dollar deal to rent artificial intelligence chips from Google to develop new AI models, The Information reported on Thursday, citing a person involved in the talks.】

item.title: MP材料公司受益于美国政府价格支持，第四季度扭亏为盈
item.description: 稀土企业MP Materials周四宣布，受其与美国政府签订的价格支持协议及磁性材料销售推动，公司第四季度扭亏为盈，业绩超出分析师预期。【原文：Rare earths company MP Materials swung to a fourth-quarter profit, it said Thursday, exceeding analysts' expectations, driven by its price support agreement with the U.S. government and sale of magnetic material.】

item.title: 巴拿马官员搜查和记黄埔子公司办公室，消息人士称
item.description: 据熟悉此次行动的消息人士透露，巴拿马当局周四搜查了香港跨国企业长江和记实业在巴拿马的一处办公场所。【原文：Panamanian authorities conducted a search of an office unit of Hong Kong conglomerate CK Hutchison in Panama on Thursday, according to a source familiar with the operation.】

item.title: 随着特朗普收紧对华科技限制，北京的出口管制日趋成熟
item.description: 中国扩大稀土出口管制近一年后，出口商仍在追问一个基本问题：当一枚小磁铁将日常用品变成管制物品时，究竟该如何界定？【原文：Almost a year after China expanded rare-earth export controls ostensibly aimed at preventing their use by foreign militaries, exporters are still asking a basic question: when does a small magnet turn an everyday product into a controlled item?】

item.title: Anthropic首席执行官称，该公司拒绝五角大楼在人工智能安全保障争议中的要求
item.description: 人工智能公司Anthropic首席执行官达里奥·阿莫代周四表示，该公司无法满足五角大楼在人工智能安全保障争议中的要求。【原文：Anthropic cannot accede to the Pentagon's requests in an AI safeguards dispute, the AI firm's CEO Dario Amodei said on Thursday.】

item.title: Netflix拒绝提高对华纳兄弟的收购报价
item.description: 网飞周四表示，在HBO Max母公司董事会认定派拉蒙天空舞影业的最新提案优于流媒体先驱现有的合并协议后，该公司将不再提高对华纳兄弟探索公司的收购报价。【原文：Netflix said on Thursday it will not raise its offer for Warner Bros Discovery after the HBO Max owner's board determined that Paramount Skydance's latest proposal was a "Superior Proposal" to the streaming pioneer's existing merger agreement.】

item.title: OpenAI概述加强安全措施的步骤，以应对加拿大校园枪击事件
item.description: OpenAI周四表示，将建立与加拿大执法部门的直接联络渠道，并加强重复违规者的检测力度。这些举措旨在提升其安全协议，此前加拿大发生了一起校园枪击事件。【原文：OpenAI said on Thursday that it will set up a direct point of contact with Canadian law enforcement and improve detection of repeat policy violators, among steps to boost its safety protocols in the wake of a recent school shooting in Canada.】

item.title: 怪兽饮料第四季度销售额和利润超出预期
item.description: 周四公布的财报显示，怪兽饮料公司第四季度销售额和利润均超出市场预期，这得益于在经济不确定性中其能量饮料需求的强劲表现。【原文：Monster Beverage beat fourth-quarter sales and profit estimates on Thursday, helped by resilient demand for its energy drinks amid economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 巴西货币委员会扩大航空公司获取公共航空基金的渠道
item.description: 巴西国家货币委员会（CMN）周四决定放宽由国家民航基金（FNAC）担保的航空公司贷款条件。该公共基金预计将从2026年起释放40亿雷亚尔（约合7.7866亿美元）资金。【原文：Brazil's National Monetary Council (CMN) decided on Thursday to loosen conditions on loans to airlines backed by the National Civil Aviation Fund (FNAC), a public fund expected to release 4 billion reais ($778.66 million) starting in 2026.】

item.title: 中国美格智能科技拟在香港上市筹集1.29亿美元
item.description: 据周五交易所公告显示，中国美格智能科技计划通过在香港上市筹集高达10.1亿港元（约合1.291亿美元）的资金。【原文：China's MeiG Smart Technology is looking to raise as much as HK$1.01 billion ($129.1 million) in its Hong Kong listing, according to an exchange filing on Friday.】

item.title: 墨西哥贝克莱公司第四季度利润下滑13%，因税负加重
item.description: 墨西哥贝克莱公司——全球最大的龙舌兰酒生产商——周四公布的财报显示，其第四季度净利润同比下滑12.8%，主要受销售额下降和税率上升影响。【原文：Mexico's Becle , the world's largest tequila maker, on Thursday posted a 12.8% drop in its fourth-quarter net profit compared to a year earlier, brought about by a dip in sales and higher tax rates.】

item.title: 博彩巨头Flutter预测2026年利润远低于预期，因美国市场面临挑战
item.description: FanDuel母公司Flutter预测2026年利润增长将较为温和，远低于分析师预期。这主要是由于这家博彩巨头在美国核心市场面临挑战，加之其通过促销和奖金吸引客户的尝试效果不佳。【原文：FanDuel-owner Flutter forecast modest profit growth for 2026 far below analyst expectations due to challenges in the betting giant's main U.S. market compounded by its misfiring attempts to win customers over with promotions and bonuses.】
